title: Tech that refuses to die
intro: Why is some old technology still used? Georgie and Phil discuss this and teach you some useful vocabulary.
this_week_question: What was the name of the first computer developed for home use in the UK?
a) the Commodore 64? b) the Sinclair ZX80? or, c) the BBC Micro?
Listen to the programme to hear the answer.

vocab.desc: no longer in use, having been replaced by something newer, better or more fashionable

vocab.text: if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it
vocab.desc: (idiom) used to say that if something is working satisfactorily, there is no reason to try to change it
machinery using metal springs and wheels which move when wound up with a key
the traditional typewriter arrangement of keys in which the top line begins with the letters q,w,e,r, t and y
using exactly the same words as were originally used
